DATATYPE.Description: A very small integer. The signed range is -128 to 127. The unsigned range is 0 to 255.
A small integer. The signed range is -32768 to 32767. The unsigned range is 0 to 65535.
A medium-size integer. The signed range is -8388608 to 8388607. The unsigned range is 0 to 16777215.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A normal-size integer. The signed range is -2147483648 to 2147483647. The unsigned range is 0 to 4294967295.
A large integer. The signed range is -9223372036854775808 to 9223372036854775807. The unsigned range is 0 to 18446744073709551615.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.
A small (single-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -3.402823466E+38 to -1.175494351E-38, 0, and 1.175494351E-38 to 3.402823466E+38.

A normal-size (double-precision) floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Allowable values are -1.7976931348623157E+308 to -2.2250738585072014E-308, 0, and 2.2250738585072014E-308 to 1.7976931348623157E+308.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
This is a synonym for DOUBLE.
An unpacked floating-point number. Cannot be unsigned. Behaves like a CHAR column.
This is a synonym for DECIMAL.
A date. The supported range is \a1000-01-01\a to \a9999-12-31\a.
A date and time combination. The supported range is \a1000-01-01 00:00:00\a to \a9999-12-31 23:59:59\a.
A timestamp. The range is \a1970-01-01 00:00:00\a to sometime in the year 2037. The length can be 14 (or missing), 12, 10, 8, 6, 4, or 2 representing YYYYMMDDHHMMSS, ... , YYYYMMDD, ... , YY formats.
A time. The range is \a-838:59:59\a to \a838:59:59\a.
A year in 2- or 4-digit format (default is 4-digit).

A fixed-length string (1 to 255 characters) that is always right-padded with spaces to the specified length when stored. values are sorted and compared in case-insensitive fashion according to the default character set unless the BINARY keyword is given.
A variable-length string (1 to 255 characters). Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion unless the BINARY keyword is given.
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
This is a synonym for CHAR(1).
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters. Values are sorted and compared in case-sensitive fashion.
A column maximum length of 255 (2^8 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 65535 (2^16 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 16777215 (2^24 - 1) characters.
A column maximum length of 4294967295 (2^32 - 1) characters.
An enumeration. A string object that can have only one value, chosen from the list of values.
A set. A string object that can have zero or more values, each of which must be chosen from the list of values.
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype
Geographic Datatype

COLUMN.Comments: The unique id from JEDI
Defines active projects that will appear in lists
The charge number for the project
The image for the project
The project\as home page
The project\as data management page
The url for the project\as field catalog
The stylesheet for the project
The unique id for the note set
The date and time the notes were entered into the db.
The contact from JEDI who created the notes.
The actual notes being stored.
The project that this note is associated with.
The notes id that is to be connected to the project.
The name of the status that will be displayed on web pages and in other tables.
The CSS style to use to display the status in a web page.
The description of the status to prevent confusion between similar statuses. This could possibly be displayed in a tooltip.
THe project that the group is associated with.
The category id from JEDI that is to be associated with the project.
A URL for a map for the category for the project.
A URL for a table for the category for the project.
A URL for an instrument for the category for the project.
The project that is being assigned a contact.
The contact from JEDI that is being assigned to a project.
The type of the contact. (What they are doing for the project.)
If the contact is to be included on emails for the project.
The id number for the project and group name.
The project that the group is for.
The name of the processing group as it is to be displayed.
The status of the processing group.
The dataset that will be created from this group.
The text for a link associated with the processing group. (Do we want to keep this?)
The URL for a link associated with the processing group. (Do we want to keep this?)
The notes id for the group.
A flag to mark if this note is a QC note for the processing group.
The JEDI dataset id.
The URL where the data was retreived or is located.
The local ingest location of the data. (/ingest/...)
The local archive location of the data. (/archive/codiac/...)
The dataset id for the notes.
The notes id for the dataset.
The dataset id that is being processed.
The processing group id that the dataset belongs to.
The id for the raw dataset that the processing is working from.
The current status of the processing of the dataset.
The location of the processing information (/work/[PROJ]/...)
The location of the How To document for the processing.
If the best software tar ball has been created. (The name can automatically be generated by the tool).
The id number for the network. (Do we still want to keep this?)
The platform id number for the network. This should match the id number in jedi.platform
A flag to mark if there are questions in the processing of the data.
The dataset id for the processing notes.
The processing group id for the processing notes.
The foreign key to the actual processing notes.
A flag to tell if this note is a QC note.
The dataset id that is being associated with the project for loading.
The project id that is being associated with the dataset for loading.
The status of the loading of the dataset.
The date that the loading was entered into the DTS.
The date that the raw data is expected to be available to us.
The jedi.contact.contact_id of the person who is to process the dataset.
The date that the dataset processing was finished.
The jedi.contact.contact_id of the person who is to load the dataset into JEDI.
The date that the loading of the dataset was completed.
The jedi.contact.contact_id of the person who is to check the dataset in JEDI.
The date that the loading was checked. (This will be that date that shows up in the ML.)
A flag to mark if this dataset should be processed for the project.
A flag to mark if this dataset is to be included in the ML for the project.
A flag to override other functionality to mark this dataset as in progress.
A flag to mark if this dataset was updated since its original checking.
The dataset that the loading notes are associated.
The project that the dataset loading notes are associated.
The id of the notes that are the loading notes for the dataset for the project.

RELATION.FKFieldsComments: The foreign key to the raw dataset id\n
